greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerator of average distance traveled by n-dimensional fly.
comment: The average distance is actually d(n)=2*n!!/(n+1)!! if n is odd, and d(n)=(1*Pi)*4*n!!/(n+1)!! if n is even. So a(n) = numerator(d(n)) if n is odd and a(n) = numerator(Pi*d(n)) if n is even. - _Michel Marcus_, May 24 2013
reference: S. Janson, On the traveling fly problem, Graph Theory Notes of New York, Vol. XXXI, 17, 1996.
link: S. Janson, On the traveling fly problem
program: (PARI) a(n) = {if (n % 2, eo = 2, eo = 4); numerator(eo*prod(i=0, floor((n-1)/2), n-2*i)/prod(i=0, floor(n/2), n+1-2*i));} \\ _Michel Marcus_, May 24 2013
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
